title: Why mourners are opting to scatter ashes by drone
description: Former RAF pilot Christopher Mace says his time in the services inspired the idea.

title: Tonton Zola Moukoko: My Championship Manager fame
description: Tonton Zola Moukoko gained a cult following after featuring in Championship Manager 01/02.

title: Nurses set to hold first UK-wide strike
description: The NHS is braced for the walkout by Royal College of Nursing members in a dispute over pay.

title: COP27: Rishi Sunak urges world to move faster on renewable energy
description: The prime minister will travel to the COP27 summit in Egypt on Sunday to discuss climate change.

title: Liberal Democrats: Give struggling homeowners £300 a month
description: People whose mortgage payments had risen more than 10% would get a grant, under the party's plan.

title: Chantelle Cameron beats Jessica McCaskill to become the undisputed light-welterweight champion
description: Chantelle Cameron becomes the undisputed light-welterweight champion after a unanimous decision victory over Jessica McCaskill

title: Cardiff head teacher who faced racism fights for change
description: There are 1,245 head teachers in Wales but Reena Patel is one of only five from an ethnic minority.

title: Cost of living: Pub halves beer and cider choice to survive
description: A landlord is pinning energy bills to walls to show regulars why the cost of their pint has gone up.

title: Aaron Carter: Singer, rapper and brother of Backstreet Boys' Nick dies aged 34
description: Aaron Carter was the younger brother of Backstreet Boys' Nick Carter.

title: Rugby League World Cup: England produce 'royal performance' in front of Princess of Wales
description: England produce a "royal performance" in front of the Princess of Wales to reach the semi-finals of the World Cup.

title: Ireland 19-16 South Africa: Hosts hold off late Springboks fightback to win
description: Ireland underline their credentials as the world's number one side as they hold off a late South Africa fightback to take a deserved win.

title: Erling Haaland says penalty against Fulham ‘one of the most nervous moments' of his life
description: Manchester City striker Erling Haaland says stepping up to take the penalty that gave his side victory over Fulham was 'one of the most nervous moments' of his life.

title: Everton 0-2 Leicester: Youri Tielemans' spectacular goal helps Foxes overcome Toffees
description: Leicester City climb out of the Premier League relegation zone as Youri Tielemans’ sensational first-half strike earns Brendan Rodgers’ side their third win in four league games.

title: Multiple Tornadoes hit southern US states
description: One dead and several injured as powerful storms hit Texas, Oklahoma and Arkansas

title: Man City 2-1 Fulham: Injury-time Erling Haaland penalty sends defending champions top
description: Substitute Erling Haaland scores an injury-time winner from the penalty spot to give 10-man Manchester City victory over Fulham and send the defending champions top of the table.

title: Jack Dorsey: Twitter co-founder breaks silence on Elon Musk takeover
description: The former CEO appeared to agree with the dismissals, saying he had grown the company "too quickly".

title: Wales 23-55 New Zealand: Rampant All Blacks outclass hosts with eight-try show
description: New Zealand extend their winning sequence against Wales to 33 games with a thrilling 55-23 victory in the Autumn Nations Series opening game in Cardiff.

title: Thousands join London protest calling for general election
description: Demonstrators also want action on low pay and the repeal of "anti-union" laws.

title: Climate change: Where does Rishi Sunak stand ahead of COP27?
description: There are signs tackling global warming has moved down the government's agenda, writes Laura Kuenssberg.

title: Ukraine war: Kyiv warns Iran of consequences for supporting Russia
description: Western officials believe Russia is using Iranian drones to target Ukrainian infrastructure.

title: Spain cannabis: Police claim largest ever seizure
description: The weight of the seized plants is roughly equivalent to more than five adult African elephants.

title: Scotland 28-12 Fiji: Scotland struggle to impress despite Murrayfield win
description: Scotland labour to an autumn international win over determined Fiji on a very uncomfortable afternoon for Gregor Townsend's side at Murrayfield.

title: Afghan female student injured in suicide attack passes university entrance exams
description: Fatemeh Amiri lost an eye and suffered severe injuries when a bomber struck a tuition centre in Kabul.

title: Twitter UK staff get deadline over cuts consultation
description: Hundreds affected by Twitter's worldwide job cuts have three days to elect a representative.

title: FA Cup: Connor Wickham scores amazing lob from halfway line
description: Connor Wickham scores an amazing lob from inside the centre circle to seal Forest Green's 2-0 victory over non-league South Shields in the FA Cup.

title: T20 World Cup: Hales and Buttler lay foundation for England win
description: Opening batters Alex Hales and Jos Buttler get England off to a fast start to chase down Sri Lanka's 141 and qualify for the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup.

title: Jordan Bardella: French National Rally has new leader to replace Le Pen
description: Jordan Bardella, 27, is the first National Rally leader not to come from the Le Pen family.

title: Ben Chilwell: Chelsea left-back set to miss World Cup with hamstring injury
description: Chelsea say England left-back Ben Chilwell is expected to miss the World Cup after a scan showed he had a "significant" hamstring injury.

title: Dover attack driven by right-wing ideology - police
description: Firebomb attack at Dover immigration centre was primarily motivated by an extremist right-wing ideology, anti-terror police say

description: Alex Hales helps England's innings get off to fast start chasing 142 to beat Sri Lanka, before falling for 47.

title: Could this be the world's smallest pony?

description: Nike suspends its relationship with Brooklyn Nets player Kyrie Irving after he promoted a documentary which contained anti-Semitic material.

description: The site's new owner says he had "no choice" but to slash jobs - cuts which appear to affect 50% of staff.

title: 'We know where your family live' - Ukrainian fighters face online death threats
description: A BBC investigation finds that Ukrainian soldiers and pro-Ukrainian activists are being targeted on Telegram.

title: Climate change: Decarbonising UK public buildings to cost £25-30bn
description: The government estimates it will need £25-30bn to convert buildings to low-carbon heating, the BBC learns.

title: Russians said they’d take my baby: A medic’s story
description: A Ukrainian woman suffered months of poor treatment and conditions while pregnant in a Russian prison.

title: The Papers: Twitter cuts begin and pensions 'stealth tax raid'
